author: By Benet Wilson
title: Another Five Great Travel Apps
text:
I am a freak when it comes to travel apps on my iPhone. I feel that the growth of apps have given passengers a high level of control over the travel process. I'm a strong proponent of downloading all the ones I hear about and trying them out. People ask me all the time which ones are among my favorites. Many of them have Android and Windows versions if you're not an iPhone user. So below are another five apps you ought to give a try.
A screenshot of WorldMate. Image courtesy of WorldMate 1. WorldMate SInce I don't have a personal assistant to organize my trips, this free app comes in handy when I travel. Give it your travel information and it will spit out an itemized itinerary of your trip. It also organize flights, hotels, cars, meetings, and transportation; checks in for your flight and plots your entire trip on a map. It will even provide you with directions to your hotel and meetings. More »
2. HitList Before you go you need to know where you want to go and how much it's going to cost. Type in your destination and this free app will send you the cheapest flights to dozens of cities across the globe. It will tell you when the cheapest fares are listed and email you when fares to your chosen destination drop. More »
Image Courtesy of FareCompare 3. FareCompare This app gives you real-time air fare alerts from the city of your choice. As of this morning at 10:08, I can go to Boston for $107. It will let you post the fare you found on your favorite social media outlet. It will even take you right to Orbitz to book the flight. More »
Passport image from travel.state.gov. Passport image from travel.state.gov 4. Smart Traveler T his official app from the U.S. State Department is great for international travelers. It offers details including official country information, travel alerts, travel warnings, maps and U.S. embassy locations, with phone numbers. More »
Image Source/Getty Images 5. Packing Pro I'm not one to pay for apps, but shell out $2.99 for this one. I f you’re like me, sometimes you forget to pack key items. This app has a catalog of 800 items and allows you to customize your packing lists based on trip types. You can also access the lists in the cloud. And the app is very handy in case your luggage is lost, because you can give a detailed list of items you packed. More »
Share
